content: Overview:Idea generation:This section shows my thought process through creating my idea for this assigment, starting with AI inspritation, and ending with the work I will use for my final submission.AI ImagesI started with generating 4 rough ideas using AI. This gave me an idea of how I wanted to continue with the rest of the assigment.(None of these AI images were used directly, they only exist for inspriation)SketchesThe following images are sketches of potential ideas that I was experimenting with before choosing the my final idea

title: Bezold Experiments
snippet: Overview:In this assigment we have to make 3 different Bezold patterns using the different color systems. At least fourcolors need to be used in the patterns. This will be done using colored pencil...
content: Overview:In this assigment we have to make 3 different Bezold patterns using the different color systems. At least fourcolors need to be used in the patterns. This will be done using colored pencils on a 5x7 paperProgress:Chosen pattern for projectFinal Images

title: Paint Pixels, and Pixie Sticks
snippet: Overview:In this assignmentwe had to choose a painting made before 1850 with a wide range of colors. Using photoshop to then split the image into a 8in square area, which will be used to do a color...
content: Overview:In this assignmentwe had to choose a painting made before 1850 with a wide range of colors. Using photoshop to then split the image into a 8in square area, which will be used to do a color study on the image. Then recreating that area in pixels with the color-aid paper. Going back to the orignal image, taking the warm and cool colors we create a color wheel, and then finally recreating the whole orignal peice on a 16x20 piece of paper.Progress:The artwork I choose was “Watson and the Shark” by John Singleton Copley.  Full original imagePixelated image progressColor wheel progressFinal color wheelOtherFinal Images

title: Albers Color Studies

content: Overview:In this assigment the idea is to create different paper works based on Josef Albers Interaction of Colorwith to improve perception of color.Progress:Choosing colors and cutting out parts of the color-aid paper.Testing possible layouts before I glue the paper downFinal ImageImage showing all four parts of the assigment

title: Mixing Gray Tones
snippet: Overview:In this assigment we mixed paint to create different gray tonesFinal Image:Artist Statement:Mixing the three different shades of gray turned out to be easier than I expected, I did struggl...
content: Overview:In this assigment we mixed paint to create different gray tonesFinal Image:Artist Statement:Mixing the three different shades of gray turned out to be easier than I expected, I did struggle slightly creating a warmer toned gray but I belive that my results ended looked nice.

title: Paint Color Chart
snippet: Overview:In this exercise we mixed 15 different paint colors with each other, and use the resulting color in a grid to create a “chart” of colors.Progess:Approximately half way through the exercise...
content: Overview:In this exercise we mixed 15 different paint colors with each other, and use the resulting color in a grid to create a “chart” of colors.Progess:Approximately half way through the exercise, when starting the 11th colorFinal Image:Artist Statement:For this assigment I started at the top of the chart mixing colors and went down 1 row at a time. Keeping a constant pattern made this entire project much easier.

title: App Exploration
snippet: Overview:In this assigment we were required to take a picture using a specific app based around an artists work.Final Image:Artist Statement:I like how the photograph of bubbles turned out, the way...
content: Overview:In this assigment we were required to take a picture using a specific app based around an artists work.Final Image:Artist Statement:I like how the photograph of bubbles turned out, the way the colors of the bubbles match the background creates a nice harmony in the image. It was an intentional composition choice and I think it makes the bubbles stand out more. It was interesting to see how the colors blended together and the final result looks great.
